2313020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313020
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 001
2313020.text: Ibn Abi'l-Hudhayl said, "Messenger of Allah visited a man with one of his companions. When he entered the house, his companion began to look around. 'Abdullah told him, 'By Allah, it would have been better for you if your eyes had been gouged out."

2313030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313030
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 002
2313030.text: Nafi' reported that a group of the people of Iraq visited Ibn 'Umar. They saw a gold crown on one of their servants and looked at one another. He remarked, "How quick you are to see evil!"

2313040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313040
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 003
2313040.text: Abu Hurayra said, "There is no good in excess words."

2313050.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313050
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 004
2313050.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The worst of my community are those who speak a lot, those who are diffuse in speech and those who fill their mouth with words. The best of my community are the best of them in character."

2313060.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313060
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 005
2313060.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The worst person is someone who is two-faced. He is the person who comes to one group of people with one face and another group of people with another face."

2313070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313070
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 006
2313070.text: 'Ammar ibn Yasir said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "The person who has two faces in this world will have two tongues of the Fire on the Day of Rising.' He passed by a stout man and said, 'This is one of them.'"

2313080.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313080
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 007
2313080.text: 'Urwa ibn az-Zubayr heard 'A'isha say, "A man asked permission to visit the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Prophet said, 'Give him permission. He is an evil brother of his tribe.' When he entered he spoke kindly to him. I said, 'Messenger of Allah, you said what you said and then you spoke kindly to him.' He replied, 'Yes, 'A'isha. The worst of people is the one people avoid due to his harsh nature.'"

2313090.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313090
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 008
2313090.text: 'Imran ibn Husayn said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Modesty brings nothing but good." Bashir ibn Ka'b said, "It is written in books of wisdom, 'From modesty comes dignity. From modesty comes tranquillity.''" 'Imran said, "I relate to you from the Messenger of Allah and you then relate to me from some book?!"

2313100.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313100
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 009
2313100.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "Modesty and belief are together. If one of them is removed, the other is removed."

2313110.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313110
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 010
2313110.text: Abu Bakra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Modesty is part of belief. Belief is in the Garden. Foul language is part of coarseness and coarseness is in the Fire."

2313120.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313120
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 011
2313120.text: Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyya said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had a large head and large eyes. When he walked, he bent forward as if he was walking up a hill. When he turned around, he turned completely."

2313130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313130
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 012
2313130.text: Abu Mas'ud said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Part of what people know of the words of first prophethood is that if someone does not possess shyness, then he will do as he pleases."
